{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3316649,"name":"","username":"rachitkakkar","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rachitkakkar/{size}/268638_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-24T16:53:27.713Z","cooked":"

Hey y’all! I am looking for a driver station that I can use to control a robot on an M1 Macbook Air. I have tried a couple options mentioned here earlier, but have run into many issues:

  • Virtualizing Windows with UTM (DriverStation didn’t start after install)
  • OpenDS (wouldn’t launch because of my computer being ARM, tried the jar file recommended in Error when starting on M1 Mac · Issue #19 · Boomaa23/open-ds · GitHub, which launched but did not connect to the robot)
  • Conductor (this was the only one that actually seemed to connect to the robot, albeit with a few errors in the terminal, but I could not get an Xbox controller to show up as a joystick)

Has anyone been able to solve this problem and could point me in the right direction? Especially with getting Xbox controllers to connect to an M1 Mac.

Thanks!
